result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MARK R. PETERSEN

records.addlTxt:
3:23 PM Defendant MARK R. PETERSEN in court.  Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court for MARK R. PETERSEN.  Attorney Tucker T. Tellefson in court for State of Wisconsin.  No resolution.  Attorney Goldin requests to be heard on bond, change to a no violent contact.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law to address bond today.  The State objects to a bond modification.  Victim addresses the court.  The court will not amend bond.  There was a speedy trail demand made 9/22/22 but the defendant is not in custody.  The Court will set for Jury Trial.  Bond Continues.
Jury trial scheduled for February 14, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2023 at 08:45 am.
CONDITIONS: No contact with V1 or their residence in Neenah PD report 22-14686. Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are at a prior hearing.

2:42 PM Defendant MARK R. PETERSEN in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court for MARK R. PETERSEN.  Prosecuting attorney Tucker T. Tellefson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Goldin was just appointed on this case.  DE requests bond reduction to a signature bond.  The State doesn't object to a signature bond.  The Court will set a $200 signature bond with same conditions. Victim addresses the court.  The DE requests a speedy trial.  The Court will set a plea/sent date, we will schedule the trial at that time.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
